metadata.feature_description: Delete existing custom URLs from the system

steps.action: Navigate to Home page S.E.O. settings via Persona Bar > Manage > Pages > Home > Advanced > S.E.O.
steps.expected: S.E.O. tab opens showing URLs for this page
steps.actual: S.E.O. tab opened showing URLs for this page with automatic URL '/'

steps.action: Click Add URL and create custom URL '/test-custom-url-for-deletion'
steps.expected: Custom URL is created and appears in the list
steps.actual: Custom URL '/test-custom-url-for-deletion' was created and displayed in the URLs list with SuperUser Account as creator

steps.action: Click the delete (trash) icon for the custom URL
steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Are you sure you want to remove this URL?' and Cancel/Delete buttons

steps.action: Click Delete button to confirm deletion
steps.expected: URL is removed from the list
steps.actual: URL was successfully deleted and removed from the URLs list

steps.expected: Both custom URLs appear in the list
steps.actual: Both custom URLs were created - '/url-to-delete-2' (Active 200) and '/url-to-delete-1' (Redirect 301)

steps.action: Click delete icon for first URL '/url-to-delete-2'
steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to remove this URL?'

steps.expected: First URL is removed, second URL remains
steps.actual: First URL '/url-to-delete-2' was deleted, '/url-to-delete-1' still visible in list

steps.action: Click delete icon for second URL '/url-to-delete-1'
steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog appeared for second URL

steps.expected: Second URL is removed, only automatic URL '/' remains
steps.actual: Second URL was deleted successfully, only the automatic '/' URL remains in the list
Custom URL '/cancel-test-url' was created and displayed in the URLs list

steps.action: Click delete icon for the URL, then click Cancel in confirmation dialog
steps.expected: URL is NOT deleted and remains in the list
steps.actual: After clicking Cancel, the URL '/cancel-test-url' was preserved and still visible in the URLs list

observations: URL Management is a page-level feature accessible via Pages > [Page] > Advanced > S.E.O. tab, not a site-level setting
The DeleteCustomUrl endpoint uses UrlIdDto with SeqNum property to identify which URL to delete
Delete icons are positioned next to edit icons in the URL row; precise mouse positioning required to click the correct icon
When creating a second custom URL on the same page, the first custom URL's type changed from 'Active (200)' to 'Redirect (301)'
Delete confirmation dialog provides clear Cancel and Delete buttons for user action
URL deletion is immediate - no page save required after deletion
